alert.note: Alert for Bailey; Briscoe; Castro; Cochran; Hale; Hockley; Lamb; Parmer; Swisher (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued January 15 at 3:03AM CST until January 16 at 10:00AM CST by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST TODAY... ...WIND CHILL WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 10 AM CST TUESDAY... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 10 below zero. For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 25 below zero. * WHERE...Bailey, Cochran, Hale, Hockley, Lamb, Briscoe, Castro, Parmer, and Swisher Counties. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Advisory, until noon CST today. For the Wind Chill Warning, from 6 PM this evening to 10 AM CST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...The dangerously cold wind chills could result in hypothermia or frostbite if precautions are not taken. Exposed skin may become quickly frostbitten or frozen.
info.instruction: Avoid outdoor activities if possible. Use caution while outside and wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Several layers of warm clothing will keep you warmer than a single heavy coat. Wrap pipes with insulation and seal windows to avoid loss of heat from your home. Keep a slow steady stream of water running from indoor faucets, and open cabinet doors to allow warm air to circulate around inside pipes. Keep pets indoors as much as possible.

area.areaDesc: Bailey; Briscoe; Castro; Cochran; Hale; Hockley; Lamb; Parmer; Swisher
